Different areas use different amounts of energy
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 4 Archive (PS2): Adventure Information: Different areas use different amounts of energy
By Harrabcat on Monday, December 1, 2003 - 09:53 pm:

Ok Heres the test for the Different Area's

--TogleKalaragiPromiassKawrea
Test 115244046
Test 216253947
Test 316243845
Average15.624.33946


Procedure
1. You'll need a Garu, Access to all 4 Adventure area's, the ability to count to 20, patience.
2. Go into the area you wanna Experiment with your Garu and 2 other monsters.
3. With your Garu in your lead start walking (not running) and count your Garu's steps (Each leg counts he should be lifting them high so it'll be obvious) Taking note of how much energy you have at the begining.
4. After 20 Steps (the seconds he puts foot touches the ground) stop and look at the energy you have remaining.
5. Subtract this from the energy you had at the beginning and you have how much energy you used... Repeat a few times then move on to next area and do it all over again

Reasons to start over during the walk
1. If you see a monster
2. If you accidently run
3. If you accidently stop
4. If you hit a wall
5. If you can't see your Garu because of plants or other materials in the area
6. You feel you didn't walk in a very straight line

Conclusion
The higher level adventure area's use up more energy then the lower level adventuring area's
